file_content.text: On Odessen, light and dark exist in perfect balance, forming a nexus in the Force. There is another world like it... Zakuul.
Arcann and his Knights learned to use the Force in a different way from Jedi and Sith. It's why we couldn't truly defeat them.
I faced plenty of warriors from Zakuul. They fell, the same as everyone else.
I've defeated many.
Don't confuse them with Arcann. And his sister is another problem entirely.
I'll sacrifice anything to stop Arcann and bring down Zakuul.
No sacrifice is too great.
Imitation. The sincerest form of failure.
Darth Marr.
Valkorion destroyed my flesh, but not my reason for being.
Is defeating your old master so important that you refuse to die?
Revenge is what drives you.
I have no use for vengeance. My goal remains the same: defend the Empire.
After my defeat, I sought an ally to make things right again. But only one in all the galaxy was my equal.
We met on this world. We argued, explored... and found an understanding. We now pass that knowledge to you.
I can't decide what's worse, that you went soft or Satele fell to the dark side.
I don't trust either of you.
If our roles were reversed, I'd feel the same doubt.
No one is more surprised than I am to be here, in this moment. But I trust the will of the Force.
We do not offer empty platitudes. We do not promise easy victory.
But if you listen with an open mind, you will soon have a weapon that could defeat Arcann.
Make your path.
What makes Arcann and his followers so different from Jedi or Sith?
How do they use the Force?
Don't cover your failure with excuses about how superior the enemy is. You just lack the strength to face them.
No, it's because you're weak.
You're starting to understand.
Jedi approach the Force as a companion, and Sith try to enslave it. Arcann and his kind... negotiate. They bargain with the Force in exchange for its power.
The more they offer in sacrifice, the greater their reward--and they'll pay any price. That's what makes them strong. You must become stronger.
Master Satele, that goes against everything you ever taught me. It's the kind of thing Valkorion would say.
That isn't the Jedi way.
I thought only Sith cared about being the most powerful. You sound like Valkorion.
That isn't very Jedi-like.
We are nothing like that man.
If the enemy is willing to sacrifice everything, what price can we pay that they won't?
You're asking the impossible.
Everyone has limits. You must transcend your own.
Nothing can hurt you, now. All that armor is pointless.
Even in death, you're armored.
I appear to you as I wish to be remembered. A symbol.
I saw that man die five years ago. What is this, Jedi? A hologram?
I don't believe this is real.
The Force is more powerful than death. You will learn.
I knew something was wrong. You turned her to the dark side. She's your apprentice.
You corrupted Satele Shan.
Apprentice... master... those labels have no meaning here.
If Jedi and Sith have found a way to work together, I want to know how.
Teach me.
I don't want your help. I've had enough people telling me what to do!
Just leave me alone.
We don't want to control you.
You never cared about becoming immortal. But I guess dying changes everything.
This isn't your style, Marr.
Denying the void's embrace... taxes me. But I will not leave our Empire undefended.
Jedi approach the Force as a companion, and Sith try to enslave it. But Arcann's knights believe the Force is their reward for serving an ideal.
They swear their lives to the Eternal Emperor. The more they honor his commandments, the greater their power.
The knights obey their master without question, sacrificing everything for his triumph. Devotion makes them strong. You must become stronger.
The knights of Zakuul are slaves to the Eternal Emperor. I will never be like them.
I have no master.
Those who do not bend... break.
I swore to join Arcann's father. He gave me power in return. That should be enough.
I already serve Valkorion.
Power, without loyalty. Duty, without sacrifice.
All we ask is that you listen with an open mind--and learn from our failures.
To forge the future, you must first break with the past. Victory over Arcann requires new perspectives... and new weapons.
Follow the will of the Force into the wilderness beyond this camp. Find what we left for you, and meet us in the cave.
Tick-tock, tick-tock, tick-tock....
I have a future, Vaylin. But you don't.
Yes, and you aren't in it.
Just the way I like it.
I knew this had to be a trap. How long have that Jedi and Sith been helping you?
Satele and Marr betrayed me!
Surrounded by assassins. Poor, pitiful you.
I believe in this...
[Attack.]
My brother will have your head!
You think you're winning! I love it!
No more holding back! Never again!
I'll see you again... every time you close your eyes....
Tell me... Do you believe in the future?
